name: ploddingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is slow, continuous, and not exciting: Most of the time, the play's dialogue is ploddingly dull. She gave me the impression that she was making ploddingly reliable progress.
More examplesFewer examplesI find that the fashion industry can be ploddingly predictable at times.The film proceeds in a ploddingly familiar way.Harry's mind works ploddingly and at first he could not appreciate the brilliance of the idea.A narrator ploddingly explains every single detail of the plot's development.
